column4: hello, when i restart my computer the sound blaster beeps more that 3 times. is it possible to disable it? is it assosiated with the specific OS or it is independant hardware aprt which should be managed from the BIOS?
: beep? is it before the OS loaded?
: beep? is it before the OS loaded? If so then there's something wrong in your hardware
when restarting (already inside OS), before loading ubuntu screen, while loading ubuntu screen. this times.
: is it a wailing sound (or at least something like that) ?
: wailing sound usually means your CPU fan is failing
you talk about the case itself or about this beep sound? i don't hear strange things from the case.
: so is it from your speaker?
it is coming from the case, but it is like beep. afaik it is sound blaster. i hear it also when i'm in the tty's and no gui is loaded and type commands which i'm trying to autocomplete with tab.
: agree with Slart, any problem after this beep? (PC hangs/restart?)
no as of now.
: the easisest wway to check you MB i believe is open up you case -_-a (at least for me)
: that's it, it's an ASUS A8V then
: well, to be honest, I don't quite understand your problem, it can range from driver issues to hardware failure... i need to narrow it a bit
: do your sound (e.g. music) works well?
yes, my music works well.
: then, when exactly that beep come?
when i click the shurdown/restart button comes first beep.
: i believe it's normal, it does also in my box
so this beeps are normal? and they can't be stopped?
: i suppose
: I don't think it's annoying, in fact it notice me that my system is succesfully shutting down
/ Slart : FYI, my MB is an ECS A780GM-M V1.1
/ Slart : GM-A, I mean
